text: We're in the back of the store.
Dad has just given me two pennies.
in this big crack in the floorboards.
I'm saving them so I can buy a town.
That's what I tell my big brother Derek anyway.
And now they want his watch.
Let me grab some coffee, then I'll be back.
Okay, I took all the coffee, but I will make a fresh pot.
Do you guys know already? Was Ryan here or something?
Whoa. What the hell was that?
Because we thought you were dead.
Why would you think I was dead?
Because no one has seen you.
I miss a couple of days of work and suddenly i'm--
No one has seen you in 12 days.
I went on kind of a bender, and it...
For a minute, I thought, um,
I thought I was going over the edge.
And then even Ryan got worried about me.
He says there's partying and then there's...
What I was doing was scary.
So he dragged me to a meeting--
many meetings, a lot of meetings--
and I am so grateful to him for that
because he helped me. You know, he helped.
And I didn't realize that it was 12 days,
and I can just imagine what all of you thought,
and I am so sorry that you thought I was dead.
Addie, I am so sorry, but that's what I was doing.
and I was getting right with my higher power
and I was just being sober every day.
I mean, I'm gonna have to go to two or three meetings a day
for as long as it takes,
Oh, I was so worried about you.
I know. Thank you for worrying.
But you didn't need to. Ryan saved me.
Now apparently, I have a lot of work to catch up on,
so I will talk to you guys later.
Charlotte, she--she seemed okay to me.
That's because you're not an addict.
You'd be surprised at how adept an addict can be
I toyed with the idea of specializing in addiction
Possible-- I mean, is it just possible,
that you're blowing this out of proportion?
Because of my history, I know the games,
I know what love is. I just...
♪ now we're flyin' through the stars ♪
♪ I hope this night will last forever ♪
I'm in love with you, okay?

Come take these from me, please.
Can we talk to you for a minute?
Does she have a brain tumor,
a giant carcinoma that she wants me to excise?
That had better be what is going on here, because--
Amelia, everybody here cares about you,
and they'd like you to stay
and listen to what they have to say.
Okay. You know what? I have patients to see.
There are no patients coming today.
doctor. Dr. Shepherd, and I know how an intervention works.
You're not the one who talks. You are just the party planner.
one of you is supposed to have the guts to speak up
instead of hiding behind this chick.
One of you has to have the balls to say something to me.
I'm not letting you leave. Sheldon.
She's upset. She has a right to be upset.
Addison-- she thinks she's being ambushed.
I'm just saying that I'm not sure
this is the right way to go.
Do you want to do this?
Then you can. You can do this.
If you don't get off the elevator, I will fire you.
Amelia, get off the elevator, or I'll call the police on you.
And tell them you've been writing prescriptions
for your own personal drug use.
You don't know what you're talking about.
I will stay at the practice.
I said I would stay at the practice.
I did not say I would hang out with you.
- This isn't working. - A united front.
So go after her. You have to be in this.
You can't just come along for the ride.
There are times that you're gonna have to steer the ship.
I mean, can I just-- what are the qualifications
Are you even--i mean, is there a certification for this?
Are you qualified to do this?
Would you just listen to what everyone has to say?
And then I spent the bulk of my 20s in a library,
college, med school, residency, neuro fellowship.
So now I wanted to have some fun.
I made a mistake, and now I'm fine.
I would think you'd get that.
You down a bottle of wine with every meal.
and when you're sad and when it's Tuesday.
Should we do an intervention about your alcoholism?
I don't have a problem. That's the difference here.
I haven't had a drink in months.
you're more addicted to than booze is having a baby,
You waited too long, and your junk dried up,
who would want to even consider impregnating you.
And now you've got Sam, and at least he's smart enough
to not want to try and breed with you,
not even Rosemary's baby would want to live
amongst the tumbleweeds in your uterus.
I barely know you. What are you even doing here?
You're right. You don't know me.
I'm here because we all agreed we would be here.
you don't get how lonely most people are.
See, most people, they just go to work.
They go to work, they come home, maybe they have friends.
But on any given day, they're not sharing as much
or caring as much or giving as much
as all of you give to each other on a--
So, yes, you're right, I don't know you.
But I know that you have a family here
and I see that you're destroying it.
If you continue down this path,
you won't just go down alone, Amelia.
You'll take all the people that love you down with you.
What do we do now? Do we just, like, leave, or is it-- Coop.
she's not listening. She's not listening.
I'm not in favor of this.
Research shows that group confrontational strategies
with alcohol and drug abusers do not work.
She's going to go into withdrawal soon.
At a certain point, she's going to go into withdrawal.
We just have to keep her here till that happens.
Yeah, but she's not high right now.
Yes, she is. No, she's not.
She'll be coming through those doors any minute.
Her high will be on its way out,
and getting out of here to get more drugs.
She'll be a little bit sweaty, irritable, twitchy, tweaking.
My guess is, she's an oxy girl?
Nothing like oxycodone to turn a nice girl
Whatever you have to say, spit it out so I can go.
My watch? No. You have the money.
My mom gave my dad that watch.
It was a symbol of their life together...
Of how much she loved him.
Everyone's gonna take turns talking now.
And they're all here because they want to help you.
So try to keep that in mind.
This is not about anyone judging you.
You have clearly never met these people.
so I don't have anything personal to...
Uh, I was just gonna ask you if you're feeling okay.
And you're aging and your husband hates you.
So, you know, things could be worse for me.
A-Amelia-- it's okay. Pete. It's okay.
angrier than you and sicker than you,
Awesome. Are you lookin' for applause,
Honestly, Pete, all I have been able to think
since I saved your pathetic life is, was it worth it?
I mean, maybe saving you was a waste of my energy.
Maybe it was a waste of my mad, mad surgical skills.
Maybe you're a waste of life.
Maybe angel-of-death dude should call it a day
What do you say, cross on over to the other side?
It'd give your wife some great material for her next book,
raping her personal experiences for attention.
Oh, my god. Are you okay?
She's like... She's like a cornered dog.
because we're in the middle of it,
Why is it all on me?
your big intervention-- just screwed up people
telling me how screwed up I am?
Because last I checked, I'm a world-class neurosurgeon
So if you want to intervene, fine.
I can go all day. Can you?
Are we talking in riddles now?
Are you riddling me stuff right now?
Because I might need a pen to write this down. I gotta admit,
I'm kind of loving you right now.
You are winning better than Charlie sheen...
As long as I overlook the fact that you're a giant oxy addict
You will no longer be enabled.
Is that one of your special s.A.T. Words?
Until you get help, I'll change the locks.
You can't live at my house anymore.
Then I will call in your mother
and your brother and your sisters,
and then I will call the medical board
and report you, because I love you, Amelia,
but I will not love you to death.
It'll make withdrawal symptoms go away immediately.
from getting me high for 72 hours.
Big pharma has done us all a favor.
Amelia, please. It could help you.
a chance to hear us without being high,
I told you, I'm drug free. I have been for five days.
I am not going through withdrawal.
Amelia, we all love you. It--
it'll help you feel better. Give it a shot.
Then we can talk you through this.
You want me to stay and listen so that I can get sober?
And then I will stay as long as you want.
Why don't you come back to bed?
I want to give you something...
And you'll give me a ring...
when we put on clothes and leave this room.
♪ I can love you with my eyes closed ♪
♪ I see your heart through a blindfold ♪
My mom saved up for three years to buy it.
♪ oh, days and days of love ♪
If she gets on that elevator, it's over.
She can't leave. We lose her if she leaves.
Are we seriously considering doing this?
Okay, what if--what if we make her worse?
We don't know what's in her system already.
We're talking about giving her 40 milligrams of oxycodone,
not shooting her up with heroin.
Look, we're eight doctors in a medical office.
No, no. We're not doing this.
We're--we're not supporting her drug habit.
and--and is acting like a child--
She has a disease. It's a disease, Sam.
Okay, all right. Well, I think we should take a vote.
All those in favor of giving her oxy?
I mean, I'm here to support Addison.
If she votes for drugs, I'll vote for drugs.
You have no idea what you're doing to her. And you.
What kind of doctor are you?
we have a difference of opinion, all right?
It happens around here all the time.
You're about a century behind in your thinking.
You think addicts should, what, be locked up,
I think that Amelia should take responsibility for her actions.
should take responsibility for his heart attack?
Uh, that's not the same thing.
Why not? Because Pete has heart disease.
Jake, we both know that that is up for debate
in the medical community, all right?
The whole disease model comes from a.A.,
where the first thing they try to do
that they're powerless against their addiction.
Because drugs function differently in their bodies.
It's a "disease" that doesn't fire up
Amelia has control over that, right?
I mean, she made a choice
the first time she took those drugs,
just like she has a choice today.
You think people choose that misery?
You think they--you think they choose that life?
You think they want to be
licking drugs off of bathroom floors
and neglecting their kids and destroying their husbands
You think anyone who is not in the throes of a disease
would consciously do that to themselves?
- Is that what you think? - Jake.
Are you okay? Do you want to talk?
You think it'd be all right if, uh...
Yeah, yeah, there's lots of us in there.
I guess I hit a nerve.
There's a lot of those flying around today.
We should probably get back in there.
"I don't care how old you are, you are always someone's child.
"I work with kids all day. I see that love.
I have to give news to parents every day"... I want my drugs.

- Give me my drugs. - I want my drugs.
Give me my drugs. "Kids with diseases..."
What do we want? Drugs. "There's no worse news."
When do we want 'em? Now. What do we want? Drugs.
"It's killing me to see what this disease is doing to you." When do we want 'em? Now.
What do we want? Drugs. "There are things that you could do to treat your disease"...
When do we want 'em? Now. "And get your life back"...
What do we want? Drugs. "And you're not doing them."
When do we want 'em? Now. "You owe it to the people who love you to try to get well."
What do we want? Drugs. When do we want 'em? Now. "You at least have to try,
because you are someone's kid and because you're my friend." What do we want? Drugs.
When do we want 'em? Now! What do we want? Drugs!
What do we want? Drugs! When do we want 'em? Now!
What do we want? Drugs! When do we want 'em? Now!
My next show will be in five minutes!
What does she want? Drugs. When does she want them? Now.
That used to be a person, okay?
And she was sweet and she was funny,
and I took her to get her ears pierced,
and i-i-i-i did her hair for her for prom,
and I told her all about birth control
when she didn't know who to ask,
and we were sisters, you know?
That used to be Amelia Shepherd.
That used to be someone that I love,
And if it means me giving her some oxy
so she can shut up and listen,
so she doesn't get on that elevator?
Great. Fine. I'll be her drug dealer.
To get the keys to the drug dispensary.
but that--that's no excuse to throw it away like this.
Everybody here has been through hell and back--
We're not using. I swear to god, Sam--
shut up! You want to stop being a drug ad--you--
this is how you stop being a drug addict.
Grow up! Take some responsibility for yourself.
Gotta love that woman of yours, Sam.
Of course, we all know you can't commit,
so maybe you don't gotta, but I do.
Addison-- we talked about this. Absolutely not.
What the hell are you thinking?
She's thinking that Amelia's in trouble,
and if we let her leave-- thank you, Addison.
You want to do your drugs, you do 'em here,
in front of all these people who care about you.
Show them who you really are.
Or don't do the drugs at all,
and show them who you want to be.
if you keep up at this,
You're gonna walk into some O.R.,
you're gonna get behind the wheel of a car...
you don't come back from it.
You spend every day trying to be a better person,
But you can't give that mother back her child
or that husband back his wife.
You walk and you talk and you breathe,
and sometimes you even smile or laugh...
What is the point of this now?
She's so high, she can't even listen to us.
What Charlotte said was very beautiful...
30 days to get you clean and sober--
then you can start over again.
I don't think I can do it.
You can. I know you can.
We'll help you. I'll help you.
There's a great rehab facility. They have a bed waiting for you.
It's... it's right near the ocean.
I'll come see you every day.
I'll be there. Yeah, I will.
Ryan and I are getting married. Now.
- Don't speak to him like that. - You realize
you'll never get sober if you stay with him, ever.
Amelia's addiction is not Ryan's fault.
As a matter of fact, Ryan, if you want to get sober,
we'll help you, too. No, no, we won't.
Yes, we will, if that's what it takes.
No, our commitment, our concern is for Amelia.
I know, and she will do better
if the person she loves is also in the program,
There's studies on this. Sheldon, back me up.
Okay, I just think we need to discuss this before we s--
I think what Violet and Lenny said is right.
I believe we can help anyone who wants to get sober.
He didn't say he wants to get sober.
You gave him your father's watch?
Maybe just give her a little bit of space--
this is none of your business! I am speaking to my sister!
I'm not your sister. Look at this.
You took this from your mother?
Do you know how that's gonna make her feel?
What is the significance of the watch?
My mom gave it to my dad for their anniversary one year.
That is not the significance. Addison--
it's not, and you know it's not, Sam.
Two guys came into her father's store
when she was 5 year-- shut up!
You do not tell that story!
That is not your story! He was not your dad!
You do not tell that story.
You do not ever tell that story.
You ever tell that story to anyone...
And I will kill you with my bare hands.
Let's go. I want to go.
I will never love you back.
It was nice to see you all.
Hope to see you all again real soon
We're in the back of the store.
Dad has just given me two pennies.
But we don't pay attention until dad yells.

Your mom gave your dad this watch
I want to have anniversaries with you,
If we were sober, we could have kids
We could have a life, too.
Do you want to get sober with me?
This is gonna be so great.

and we go in together and we go out together.
This is a commitment. This is important.

I can do it. I can.
So how many kids do you want?
Two boys, two girls--that way, no one gets lonely.
Now you have to cut her off.

or a place to stay or her job back.

off the reception desk doesn't qualify as rock bottom?

and invited me to come for a visit.

Me and a bunch of college freshmen doing what,

but I'm gonna stay at the four seasons.

I know that... She's not mine.

I found some people that, um...
